Description: Shoulder sherd of probably Attic black-figured pottery amphora; concave profile; exterior: remains of neck black; below, black-figure decoration consisting of head of bridled horse, with added red forelock and rein in dilute brown, to right.
Curator's comments: According to Venit, the sherd is not definitely Attic.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 253-4, no. B159)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0078) (Phase 1)
